## Simple random walk simulation

```{r}
#| label: rw-simple
#| echo: TRUE
#| out.height: 1600px
#| out.width: 1600px
#| fig.align: center
#| attr-source: 'style="font-size: 0.7em;"'

T <- 50
s <- matrix(NA, nrow=T, ncol=2)
s[1,] <- c(0.5,0.5)
for(t in 2:T) {
  ## The two lines below are equivalent
  ## s[t,] <- rnorm(n=2, mean=s[t-1,], sd=0.1)
  s[t,] <- s[t-1,] + rnorm(n=2, mean=c(0,0), sd=0.05)
}

plot(s, asp=1, xlim=c(0,1), ylim=c(0,1))
arrows(s[1:49,1], s[1:49,2],
       s[2:50,1], s[2:50,2], length=0.1, col="blue")

```

## Biased random walk

\begin{equation}
  {\bf u_{t+1}} = {\bf u_t} + {\bf B}({\bf u_{t}}-{\bf s}) + {\bf \epsilon}
  \label{eq:brwalk}
\end{equation}



## Correlated random walk

$$
\begin{equation}
  {\bf R} = \gamma
  \begin{pmatrix}
    \cos(\theta) & -\sin(\theta) \\
    \sin(\theta) & \cos(\theta) 
  \end{pmatrix}
  \label{eq:crw-rotmat}
\end{equation}
where $\theta \in [-\pi,\pi]$ is the expected turn angle, and
$\gamma \in [0,1]$ dampens the persistence. 
$$
